page.title: 16Stackpole Court
page.content: Stackpole was originally a Norman settlement and it was only in the mid nineteen seventies that all feudal ties were broken.It was then that Lord Cawdor sold his estate to an insurance trust. In 1961 Lord Cawdor demolished his mansion thus causing an outcry in the locality. All that is now left are the stables and outbuildings which have been converted into flats.In the roof of the flats lives a colony of greater horseshoe bats which are extremely rare.They are now a protected species but a local man,unaware of their rarity, was intending to gas them.Luckily a bat expert was able to identify the bats, and they were saved. The stables are also said to be haunted. Many people have seen the ghost of an old lady.
